title: Case Study: Sarcopenia in an Elderly Individual
clinical_history: Mrs. Thompson is an 82-year-old retired librarian who has been experiencing progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass over the past few years. She reports difficulty performing daily activities such as getting up from a chair, climbing stairs, and carrying groceries. She has also noticed a significant decrease in her overall physical function and mobility.

nprs.affected_area: generalized muscle weakness and soreness, particularly in the lower extremities

aggrevating_factors: prolonged periods of inactivity, difficulty with balance and coordination, and performing daily activities that require strength and endurance
picture: a 24-hour picture showing Mrs. Thompson's typical daily activities, including her morning routine, meal preparation, and mobility exercises
easing_factors: rest, physical therapy, and assistive devices such as canes and walkers
past_history: history of osteoporosis, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia; has had several falls in the past year
medical_history: has been taking calcium and vitamin D supplements for osteoporosis; has a family history of muscle wasting diseases
medications: calcium and vitamin D supplements, antihypertensive medication, and statins
personal_history: widow, lives alone, and has limited social support; has a history of smoking and sedentary lifestyle
imaging: dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) scan showing significant muscle mass loss and decreased bone density
